item.title: WiFi - How to secure at best your WiFi from hackers
item.author: Author
item.description: As you could see on this tutorial WiFi is vulnerable to a plethora of attack. Don’t let any creepy stranger get into your home/company network with this tutorial ! First things first When you go on the Internet, everything you see or download is actually contained in thousands of little messages (a bit like postal mail) that are then put back in order by your computer. These messages (like mail) have a header (recipient, sender, date, etc.

item.title: How to crack any WiFi (WEP-WPA-WPA2-WPA3-WPS)
item.author: Author
item.description: I’m assuming that you are successfully operating a proper GNU/Linux distribution (if not, go check this tutorial) and that you’re not lame enough to imagine connecting to a WiFi network without a WiFi card or a USB WiFi adapter. First things first When you go on the Internet, everything you see or download is actually contained in thousands of little messages (a bit like postal mail) that are then put back in order by your computer.
